name: Chicken Adobo
description: A classic Filipino savory stew featuring chicken legs braised until tender in a tangy and salty marinade of soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and black peppercorns. The sauce is reduced to a rich, sticky glaze and served over steamed rice.
keywords: Chicken Adobo, Filipino Adobo, Filipino Cuisine, Braised Chicken, Soy Sauce Chicken, Vinegar Chicken, Chicken Legs, Comfort Food, Asian Stew, One Pot Meal, Savory Glaze, Garlic, Peppercorn, Bay Leaf, Main Course, Dinner Recipe, Traditional Filipino Food, High Protein, Dairy Free, Rice Bowl, Slow Cooked Chicken, Easy Dinner, Sweet and Salty, Stick Adobo

recipeInstructions.text: Sear the chicken in a large pan. Make sure to turn to sear all sides. Remove chicken and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Sear chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Dice onion and garlic roughly and saute until onion starts to go translucent. Add everything into the pan and add enough water to get almost to the top of the chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Saute onion and braise

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer covered for about 1 and a half hours.  Uncover and bring heat up to high and boil liquid down until it thickens. Turn chicken to ensure and even coating of thickened liquid.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer

recipeInstructions.text: Serve over rice topped with diced spring onions.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: You can use other meat like a nice fatty pork cut.
